content:
TITLE: Downloading a Specific URL with You-Get
DESCRIPTION: This command downloads a file from a specified URL using you-get.  It displays site information, title, type, and size of the resource before downloading. The downloaded file is saved to the current directory with the appropriate filename.
SOURCE: https://github.com/soimort/you-get/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ you-get https://stallman.org/rms.jpg
Site:       stallman.org
Title:      rms
Type:       JPEG Image (image/jpeg)
Size:       0.06 MiB (66482 Bytes)

Downloading rms.jpg ...
 100% (  0.1/  0.1MB) ├████████████████████████████████████████┤[1/1]  127 kB/s
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Download Video with You-Get (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Downloads a video from a given URL using You-Get with the default settings. This command downloads the video in the highest available quality. Requires You-Get to be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/soimort/you-get/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ you-get 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jNQXAC9IVRw'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Output Path and Filename with You-Get
DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to specify the output directory and filename for a downloaded video using the `-o` and `-O` options, respectively.  This is useful for organizing downloaded files and avoiding issues with default filenames that contain special characters or are incompatible with the filesystem. The example downloads a YouTube video and saves it as 'zoo.webm' in the '~/Videos' directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/soimort/you-get/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ you-get -o ~/Videos -O zoo.webm 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jNQXAC9IVRw'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Downloading from a Tumblr Post with You-Get
DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how you-get scrapes a webpage (in this case, a Tumblr post) to identify and download any interesting resources.  It analyzes the page, identifies the media content, and downloads it. This is an example of how you-get can be used to download media even when the exact URL isn't known in advance.
SOURCE: https://github.com/soimort/you-get/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ you-get https://kopasas.tumblr.com/post/69361932517
Site:       Tumblr.com
Title:      [tumblr] tumblr_mxhg13jx4n1sftq6do1_640
Type:       Portable Network Graphics (image/png)
Size:       0.11 MiB (118484 Bytes)

Downloading [tumblr] tumblr_mxhg13jx4n1sftq6do1_640.png ...
 100% (  0.1/  0.1MB) ├████████████████████████████████████████┤[1/1]   22 MB/s
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Download Video with Specified itag (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Downloads a video from a given URL using You-Get, specifying the desired format using the `--itag` option. This allows the user to select a specific quality and container format. Requires You-Get to be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/soimort/you-get/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ you-get --itag=18 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jNQXAC9IVRw'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Searching and Downloading with You-Get
DESCRIPTION: This command shows how you-get can perform a Google search for a video based on a text query and then download the most relevant result. It allows users to download videos without knowing the exact URL by using a search query. The tool may not always return the exact desired video, but it will likely be related to the search term.
SOURCE: https://github.com/soimort/you-get/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ you-get "Richard Stallman eats"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Download Video Info with You-Get (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Retrieves information about available streams for a given video URL using You-Get. The `-i` option displays a list of available quality and formats, allowing users to choose the desired version to download. Requires You-Get to be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/soimort/you-get/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ you-get -i 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jNQXAC9IVRw'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Playing a Video with You-Get and a Media Player
DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to stream a video directly to a media player (e.g., `vlc` or `chromium`) instead of downloading it. The `-p` or `--player` option is used to specify the media player. This is convenient for watching videos without saving them locally.
SOURCE: https://github.com/soimort/you-get/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ you-get -p vlc 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jNQXAC9IVRw'
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ you-get -p chromium 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jNQXAC9IVRw'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using an HTTP Proxy with You-Get
DESCRIPTION: This command configures you-get to use a specified HTTP proxy for downloading content. It uses the `-x` or `--http-proxy` option followed by the proxy address and port.  This is useful for bypassing network restrictions or accessing content that is only available through a proxy.
SOURCE: https://github.com/soimort/you-get/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ you-get -x 127.0.0.1:8087 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jNQXAC9IVRw'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install You-Get via pip (Python)
DESCRIPTION: Installs the latest version of You-Get from PyPI using pip. This command fetches and installs the package and its dependencies, making it available for use from the command line.  Requires Python and pip to be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/soimort/you-get/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ pip install you-get
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Upgrade You-Get via pip (Python)
DESCRIPTION: Upgrades You-Get to the latest version using pip. This command fetches and installs the newest version of the package from PyPI, overwriting the existing installation. Requires pip to be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/soimort/you-get/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ pip install --upgrade you-get
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Upgrade You-Get with Github develop branch (Python)
DESCRIPTION: Upgrades You-Get to the latest 'develop' branch directly from Github using pip and Git.  Useful for getting the most recent changes and bugfixes.  Requires Git to be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/soimort/you-get/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ pip install --upgrade git+https://github.com/soimort/you-get@develop
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install You-Get via Homebrew (macOS)
DESCRIPTION: Installs You-Get on macOS using Homebrew. This command simplifies the installation process by automatically managing dependencies. Requires Homebrew to be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/soimort/you-get/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ brew install you-get
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install You-Get in Pipenv Environment (Python)
DESCRIPTION: Installs You-Get in a Pipenv virtual environment. This isolates the project dependencies. It then runs you-get to check its version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/soimort/you-get/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ pipenv install -e .
$ pipenv run you-get --version
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install You-Get from Source (Python)
DESCRIPTION: Installs You-Get from the local source directory using pip. This method is useful for installing a specific version or a development version of You-Get. The dot (.) represents the current directory and is crucial for pip to locate the setup files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/soimort/you-get/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ cd path/to/you-get
$ [sudo] python -m pip install .
```

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ cd path/to/you-get
$ python -m pip install . --user
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install You-Get via Antigen (Zsh)
DESCRIPTION: Adds You-Get to your Zsh environment using Antigen.  This assumes Antigen is already installed and configured.  It adds the You-Get plugin for automatic loading and management by Antigen during shell initialization.
SOURCE: https://github.com/soimort/you-get/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
antigen bundle soimort/you-get
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install You-Get via Flox (Multi-Platform)
DESCRIPTION: Installs You-Get using the Flox package manager, which supports multiple platforms. Assumes Flox is already installed and configured.
SOURCE: https://github.com/soimort/you-get/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ flox install you-get
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install You-Get via pkg (FreeBSD)
DESCRIPTION: Installs You-Get on FreeBSD using the pkg package manager. It requires root privileges. The `pkg` command is the standard package management tool for FreeBSD systems.
SOURCE: https://github.com/soimort/you-get/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
# pkg install you-get
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Clone You-Get from Git (Shell)
DESCRIPTION: Clones the You-Get repository from GitHub using Git.  This fetches the entire source code history, allowing developers to contribute or modify the tool. Requires Git to be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/soimort/you-get/blob/develop/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Shell
CODE:
```
$ git clone git://github.com/soimort/you-get.git
```
